   make install

   - Test installing skills from anthropics/skills repository:
     ```bash
     # Test auto-discovery (should list all available skills)
     ./ai-repo add skill gh:anthropics/skills
     
     # Test specific skill paths (try 3-5 different skills)
     ./ai-repo add skill gh:anthropics/skills/skills/web-search
     ./ai-repo add skill gh:anthropics/skills/skills/pdf-processing

   - Check skill metadata is parsed correctly (name, description, version)

     ./ai-repo add agent gh:anthropics/agents
     # Or test with other known agent repositories
     ```

   - Subpath that doesn't exist exactly (should fall back to parent)
   - Multiple skills in one repo (should show interactive selection)
   - Invalid repository (should show clear error)
   - Network issues (graceful handling)

5. **Test Installation to Tools**

     ```

     ./ai-repo list

## Description

     - Validate path is a file ending in .md
     - Read and validate frontmatter

     - Call repo.Manager.AddCommand()
     - Print success message

     - Validate path is a directory
     - Check for SKILL.md inside

     - Verify folder name matches frontmatter name
     - Call repo.Manager.AddSkill()
     - Print success message

2. Add to root command in `cmd/root.go`

   - Path doesn't exist

   - Not a valid resource (no/invalid frontmatter)

title: Remove verbose config file message
description:
## Problem
The shell autocomplete and all commands show this message:
```
Using config file: /home/hans/.ai-repo.yaml
```

This should ONLY appear when running `ai-repo config` subcommands (`config get`, `config set`), not for other commands like `list`, `add`, etc., and especially not during shell completion.

## Root Cause
```go
// cmd/root.go lines 77-79 in initConfig()
if err := viper.ReadInConfig(); err == nil {
    fmt.Fprintln(os.Stderr, "Using config file:", viper.ConfigFileUsed())
}
```

This prints on every command execution because `initConfig()` is called by cobra.OnInitialize().

## Solution

**Step 1: Remove verbose output from cmd/root.go**

In `cmd/root.go`, replace lines 77-79 with:
```go
viper.ReadInConfig() // read in config file if available
```

**Step 2: Add message to config subcommands in cmd/config.go**

Add the config file path output at the START of both `configGet()` and `configSet()` functions:

In `configGet()` function (after line 66, before line 68):
```go
fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Using config file: %s\n", viper.ConfigFileUsed())
```

In `configSet()` function (after line 91, before line 94):
```go
fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Using config file: %s\n", viper.ConfigFileUsed())
```

Note: You'll need to add `"github.com/spf13/viper"` to the imports in config.go.

## Files to Modify

- `cmd/config.go` - Add viper import and message to configGet() and configSet()

title: Refactor: Rename ai-repo to aimgr with new command structure
description:
## Description
Major refactoring to rename the tool from `ai-repo` to `aimgr` with a restructured command hierarchy that better reflects the repository as one part of a larger resource management system.

## Goals
- Rename binary and all references from ai-repo to aimgr
- Implement new command structure with `repo` subcommand grouping
- Add metadata tracking for resources (timestamps, source URLs)
- Support new unified install/uninstall syntax with type prefixes
- Maintain backward compatibility where reasonable

## Current State
- Binary: `ai-repo`
- Commands: `ai-repo add/remove/list/install`
- No metadata tracking beyond what's in resource files
- Install requires explicit type: `ai-repo install skill <name>`

## Target State
- Binary: `aimgr`
- Repo commands: `aimgr repo add/remove/list/show/update`
- Install/uninstall: `aimgr install skill/<name>` `aimgr uninstall skill/<name>`
- Metadata files for each resource tracking source, timestamps
- Support multiple resources in single install/uninstall command

## New Command Structure

### Repository Management
```
aimgr repo add skill <skill-expression>     # same as current ai-repo add
aimgr repo remove skill <skill-name>        # same as current ai-repo remove
aimgr repo update skill <skill-name>        # update from source (new)
aimgr repo update                           # update all resources (new)
aimgr repo list                             # list all resources
aimgr repo list skill                       # list only skills
aimgr repo show skill <skill-name>          # show details + metadata (new)
```

### Installation
```
aimgr install skill/<name>                  # install with type prefix
aimgr install skill/<name1> command/<cmd>   # multiple resources (new)
aimgr uninstall skill/<name>                # uninstall (only symlinks to repo)
aimgr uninstall skill/<name1> skill/<name2> # multiple uninstall (new)
```

### Other
```
aimgr config get/set                        # unchanged
aimgr completion                            # unchanged
aimgr --version                             # unchanged
```

## Metadata Requirements

Each resource gets a JSON metadata file stored alongside it:
- Pattern: `<type>-<name>-metadata.json`
- Location: Same directory as resource
- Contents:
  ```json
  {
    "name": "skill-name",
    "type": "skill",
    "source_type": "github|local|file",
    "source_url": "gh:owner/repo/path or file://path",
    "first_installed": "2026-01-22T19:00:00Z",
    "last_updated": "2026-01-22T20:00:00Z"
  }
  ```

## Migration Strategy
Clean start approach:
- Keep `ai-repo` as-is (no breaking changes)
- `aimgr` is a new binary with new structure
- Users can have both installed simultaneously
- No automatic migration of data (users re-add resources if switching)
- Document migration path in README

- [ ] Tests passing

- Medium: Metadata persistence and updates
- Medium: Supporting multiple resources in single command
- Low: Binary rename (mostly find/replace)

title: Setup GitHub Actions and Release Process
description:
## Description
Setup GitHub Actions workflows and automated release process similar to dtctl, using GoReleaser for multi-platform builds and releases.

## Research Summary (from dtctl)

**dtctl** uses:
- **GoReleaser** for automated releases with multi-platform binaries
- **GitHub Actions** for CI/CD
- Two main workflows:
  - `build.yml` - Runs on every push/PR, builds for all platforms
  - `release.yml` - Triggered on git tags (v*), uses GoReleaser

**Key Features:**
- Cross-platform builds: Linux, macOS, Windows (amd64, arm64)
- Version injection via ldflags
- Checksums and archives (tar.gz/zip)
- Automated changelog generation
- GitHub Releases integration

## Instructions

### 1. Create `.goreleaser.yaml`

Based on dtctl's config, create a GoReleaser configuration:

```yaml
version: 2

project_name: ai-repo

before:
  hooks:
    - go mod tidy

builds:
  - env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    goos:
      - linux
      - darwin
      - windows
    goarch:
      - amd64
      - arm64
    ldflags:
      - -s -w
      - -X github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/pkg/version.Version={{.Version}}
      - -X github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/pkg/version.GitCommit={{.ShortCommit}}
      - -X github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/pkg/version.BuildDate={{.Date}}

archives:
  - format: tar.gz
    name_template: >-
      {{ .ProjectName }}_{{ .Version }}_{{ .Os }}_{{ .Arch }}
    format_overrides:
      - goos: windows
        format: zip

checksum:
  name_template: 'checksums.txt'

snapshot:
  version_template: "{{ incpatch .Version }}-next"

changelog:
  sort: asc
  filters:
    exclude:
      - '^docs:'
      - '^test:'
      - '^ci:'
      - Merge pull request
      - Merge branch
```

**Note**: Update `YOUR_USERNAME` to actual GitHub username

### 2. Create `.github/workflows/build.yml`

Create CI workflow that runs on every push/PR:

```yaml
name: Build

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  test:
    name: Test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version: '1.25'

      - name: Run tests
        run: go test ./...

      - name: Run vet
        run: go vet ./...

  build:
    name: Build Binaries
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: test
    strategy:
      matrix:
        include:
          - goos: linux
            goarch: amd64
          - goos: linux
            goarch: arm64
          - goos: darwin
            goarch: amd64
          - goos: darwin
            goarch: arm64
          - goos: windows
            goarch: amd64
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version: '1.25'

      - name: Get version info
        id: version
        run: |
          VERSION=$(git describe --tags --always --dirty 2>/dev/null || echo "dev")
          COMMIT=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
          DATE=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
          echo "version=$VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "commit=$COMMIT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "date=$DATE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

      - name: Build binary
        env:
          GOOS: ${{ matrix.goos }}
          GOARCH: ${{ matrix.goarch }}
          CGO_ENABLED: 0
        run: |
          BINARY_NAME="ai-repo-${{ matrix.goos }}-${{ matrix.goarch }}"
          if [ "${{ matrix.goos }}" = "windows" ]; then
            BINARY_NAME="${BINARY_NAME}.exe"
          fi
          
          go build \
            -ldflags "-s -w -X github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/pkg/version.Version=${{ steps.version.outputs.version }} -X github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/pkg/version.GitCommit=${{ steps.version.outputs.commit }} -X github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/pkg/version.BuildDate=${{ steps.version.outputs.date }}" \
            -o "bin/${BINARY_NAME}" \
            .

      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: ai-repo-${{ matrix.goos }}-${{ matrix.goarch }}
          path: bin/*
          if-no-files-found: error
          retention-days: 30
```

### 3. Create `.github/workflows/release.yml`

Create release workflow triggered by version tags:

```yaml
name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*'

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  release:
    name: Release
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version: '1.25'

      - name: Run GoReleaser
        uses: goreleaser/goreleaser-action@v6
        with:
          version: latest
          args: release --clean
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

### 4. Create `.github/workflows/lint.yml` (Optional but recommended)

```yaml
name: Lint

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  golangci:
    name: Lint
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version: '1.25'

      - name: golangci-lint
        uses: golangci/golangci-lint-action@v6
        with:
          version: latest
```

### 5. Update `.gitignore`

Add build artifacts:

```
# Binaries
bin/
dist/
ai-repo
*.exe

# GoReleaser
.goreleaser.dist.yml
```

### 6. Update README.md

Add installation section:

```markdown
## Installation

### Download Binary

Download the latest release for your platform:

**Linux (amd64)**:
```bash
curl -L https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/releases/latest/download/ai-repo_VERSION_linux_amd64.tar.gz | tar xz
sudo mv ai-repo /usr/local/bin/
```

**macOS (Apple Silicon)**:
```bash
curl -L https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/releases/latest/download/ai-repo_VERSION_darwin_arm64.tar.gz | tar xz
sudo mv ai-repo /usr/local/bin/
```

**Windows (PowerShell)**:
```powershell
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/releases/latest/download/ai-repo_VERSION_windows_amd64.zip" -OutFile "ai-repo.zip"
Expand-Archive -Path "ai-repo.zip" -DestinationPath "."
```

Or visit the [Releases page](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager/releases) to download manually.

### From Source

```bash
git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/ai-config-manager.git
cd ai-config-manager
make build
make install
```
```

### 7. Create Release Documentation

Create `docs/RELEASE.md`:

```markdown
# Release Process

## Creating a New Release

1. **Update version** in code if needed
2. **Commit all changes**
3. **Create and push tag**:
   ```bash
   git tag -a v0.1.0 -m "Release v0.1.0"
   git push origin v0.1.0
   ```
4. **GitHub Actions automatically**:
   - Builds binaries for all platforms
   - Creates GitHub Release
   - Uploads binaries and checksums
   - Generates changelog

## Version Numbering

Follow semantic versioning (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH):
- **MAJOR**: Breaking changes
- **MINOR**: New features (backward compatible)
- **PATCH**: Bug fixes
